author: Fuseworks Media
title: Serco must go - NZ First
text:
Fuseworks Media Monday, 5 October, 2015 - 13:36 
The attack on a transgender prisoner at the Serco-run Wiri prison proves yet again that Serco’s continued management is damaging and pointless, says New Zealand First. 
"The latest report of an assault adds more proof Serco’s management of New Zealand prisons is a failure," says Corrections Spokesperson and former Senior Corrections Officer Mahesh Bindra. 
"Yet another review will not change the management, but the government that decided to install a corporate to run prisons can. 
"The Minister of Corrections Peseta Sam Lotu-Iiga should sack Serco and put prisons back in state management as Serco is not managing for the safety of staff or prisoners," says Mr Bindra
